bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Emma Coleman Carter, February 2, 1883

div1.p: Carter describes his newborn son and mentions his wife and daughter.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Emma Coleman Carter, February 2, 1883
div1.p:
This letter will be a Phillippic against Eddy Champe
Laura thinks a heap of him but he certainly is a good one to holler,
His birth was on this wise he was born without any fire in the room &
with none of the usual dresses & c ready & seems to have taken that
event in high dudgeon. His provisions were unusually slow
in making their appearance & he seemed to consider that personal & was
violent & loud in his protests, but having everything he wants,
he is quiet; but had the air of an injured person who has
righted himself & no thanks to anybody, He is rather over
the average size & with a big nose & plenty of hair but short hair, He
had a very soft & sweet voice Laura says, but it is checked now.
His sister smiled at 4 days old, Eddy Champe smiled for the
first time today- 9 1/2 days old- & I think that was a “risus Sardonic-
us-”, Dedie has been afraid of him, but is reconciled now, &
makes the world of him, rocking & singing to him as to one of her
dolls, She bore her separation from Laura beautifully, fortu-
nately L. was well enough to have her with her when ever she
cried. She is so gentle in all her ways that she would never hurt any

one, She just lay by her mother & be quiet. I wish you could see her
She has been sick - sore throat but is better now, her bowels are not in good
condition either & have not been since the Wooping cough exactly as I could
wish them,

Murray's furlough is up the 28th inst. whether he will leave straight
to Memphis or go to Washington 1st I dont know: soon after that time
I probably will go - where I don't know. Laura will be well enough if
she improves as she has done. She had no fever & no pain or any trouble afterwards
I kept her quiet rather more than she wanted to but it is safer, she will
not get up till Sunday - the 12d day of E. Champe's existence.
I had a very busy time last month - a great deal of official & professional work as
well as the anxiety & care of Dedie, all evening & night, ane,
I think February will be lighter in every respect,

For ear ache - if it comes from a catarrhal inflammation of the middle ear as
in 19 cases out of 20,- Leaching the “Tragers” i.e. the gristle in front of the
ear - is the most certain & quickest. Ive seen it act like magic.
Next, best is dropping hot water (as hot as can he borne) in the ear 10 or 20
times & is very good. Frequently Calomel gr 1/2 every hour for 3 or 4 doses
Dovers powder gr 11 1/2111
will stop it, but not quick like the
others. In my experience Opiates in any form have less power over
earache than over most other pains, I wish we were together as
badly as you do

I will answer Chas letter Sunday
Tell Mary to write again.
div1.closer:
Your affecte Son Henry R. Carter Laura says Eddy's things were all ready, but that I did not know
where they were
